text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! And welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a special guest, Erin! Erin:
Hi!

Ro: She’s super cool and works at The Game
Station, and, not only does

Ro: she work at The Game Station, but I invited
her here today, because

Ro: she’s anime enthusiast. I don’t know
anyone who watches more anime than
Ro: Erin, and today, we’re gonna make ba-dew-dew-dew! Domo Brownies!

Erin: Yay! Ro: High fives! That was 
a body slam…
Ro: Now you hurt his feelings. Erin: Oh! Hug!

Ro: Oh hug, yeah! Erin: Ahhhh! Ro: It’s
OK! We’re friends again!
Erin: Oh, yeah!
Ro: Alright, let’s get started!

Ro: The things we’ll need today will be:
Brownie mix, from a box, that’s right

Ro: it’s easy! 2/3 cup of vegetable oil,
1/4 cup of water, big mixing bowl,

Ro: take it away! Erin: A wooden, oh! Spoon,
2 eggs, a cooking pan.
Ro: Let’s get started!
Ro: Now we’re gonna mix everything together.

Ro: I like box cakes because they just pre-mix
all the flour, sugar and

Ro: baking soda! There we go! OK, now you
can add the water. Erin: Yes!
Erin: Ooooop! Ro: Oooh!

Ro: Now we need 2/3 cup of vegetable oil.
Erin: Oh. Ro: Boom! Erin: Boom!
Ro: Do you just want to do an egg? Erin: Yeah.
Ro: … 2, 3, just crack! Erin: Oh! Oh!
Ro: Oh snap I won, it OK. Erin: It’s OK….

Ro: Now you’re gonna mix it together with
your wooden spoon once you've
Ro: washed your hands. Erin: Yeah!

Ro: Now I’m gonna have Erin mix all this
together.

Ro: Yeah, you’re just gonna keep mixing
until everything’s really consistent.

Ro: I’ve never made brownies before… Erin:
WHAT?!?!

Ro: On Nerdy Nummies, this is the first time.
Erin: Oh on Nerdy Nummies.

Erin: I was like, girl, you never made brownies
in your life?
Erin: What’s wrong wit you? Ro: Well I’m pro baker.

Erin: Can you call yourself a woman? Ro: Haha,
no…
Ro: I’m a Hobbit!

Ro: I think, I think we’re done now, and you’ll
just take your pan, OK, and we’re

Ro: gonna pour all the brownie mix into here,
you’re also gonna preheat

Ro: your oven to 350 and bake all of this
yumminess for about 30 minutes.

Erin: Just put that… Save some for later.
Ro: Yeah, just spread it out,
Ro: and pop this puppy in the oven.

Ro: Ding! They’re done! Once your brownies
are done baking, make sure that

Ro: they’ve had plenty of time to cool,
I like to take a toothpick and stick

Ro: it in and pull it out, and if nothing
sticks to it, just the same as a cake,
Ro: then you know that it’s ready!

Ro: This is the shape of Domo, we made this.
So we’re just going to place

Ro: it over here, and we’re going
to cut out the brownies.

Ro: Boom! Once you’ve cut out all your little
Domo’s into rectangles,

Ro: now we’re gonna make their little faces!
More rectangles!

Erin: More rectangles! Ro: Small, small rectangles.
Erin: With teeth!

Ro: Ta-da! We have cut out, 6 little Domo
mouths, they’re just little

Ro: rectangles with teeth drawn on them, and
then we put a piece

Ro: of wax paper on top, we’re gonna melt
these, these are meltable

Ro: chocolates, we have white and red, and
then we’re gonna trace the shape.

Ro: We just microwaved the chocolate for about
30 seconds, and we’re

Ro: gonna start with the white chocolate,
and do the teeth first, so we’re

Ro; gonna outline the teeth. So just get it
going, just take your time.

Ro: For fun-sies, Erin is going to make some
teeth.
Erin: I’m gonna try to make some teeth!

Ro: Those look pretty good! Erin: 1,
1 got a little bit away from me, but

Erin: that’s OK! Ro: That’s OK, he can
have a snaggle tooth!

Ro: OK, we’re gonna let these cool for about
5 minutes before we add the
Ro: red chocolate.

Ro: Now we have microwaved the red, and you’re just
gonna draw on top of the white
Ro: teeth, you can even go on top of them.

Ro: All done! Now we’re gonna put these,
in the freezer, for about 10 minutes.

Ro: Da-na! Erin: Pretty! Ro: They just
came out of the freezer,
Ro: and, they look a little weird.

Ro: But they’ll look pretty when you flip
‘em over. Erin:  It’s
fine!Yeah.

Ro: So you’re just gonna be really gentle.
Erin: OK.

Ro: Pick these little pieces of chocolate
up, and look at that!

Ro: Da-da! Domo mouth, that looks so cute!
Then you’re gonna put it on your

Ro: brownie, to give them their little mouths.
And gently press down,
Ro: the brownies are really soft.

Erin: Do I need to press it in? Ro: Yeah I
just gently, just really gently,
Ro: really slow, press it down.

Ro: Now for the last step, we’re gonna make
their eyeballs!

Ro: If you don’t have 1 of these bottles,
you can just dye um, frosting,

Ro: with food coloring. Erin: You got it,
you got it!
Ro: Such gentle, oh, oh, oh, pressure!
Ro: Oh here you go, here you go, Erin: You got it. Ro: I got it!
Erin: Oh that's perfect!

Ro: If you don’t have black frosting you
can also use chocolate chips,
Ro: that would be really cute!
Ro: Ta-da! Erin: Ah-mazing!

Ro: Domo Kun Brownies! We had a little bit
of a problem with the eyes.
Ro: That’s like… Yeah.

Erin: I don’t know what you’re talking
about, mine are perfect!

Ro: Maybe next time chocolate chips, but that’s
OK!
Erin: I think they’re great!

Ro: Thanks for watching Nerdy Nummies! We
had a lot of fun!

Ro: I’ll put Erin’s link below so you
can go check her out! She started

Ro: an anime channel? Erin: Yes, Anime Reviews,
yes.

Ro: Anime Reviews! She watches a lot of anime
and stuff, so if you’re into that…
Erin: Come on over! Ro: Go visit her!
Ro: OK, bye-bye!
Erin: Bye!
Erin: Done!
Ro: OW!
